TopicTitle: If you could go anywhere in the solar system where would you go?

Articles.Content: Of course there are a few things like guaranteed return and no radiation. I just thought it would be fun to see where people want to go! I couldn't do a poll because there are hundreds of things in the solar system. I would personally go to Titan.

Maybe Saturn... not which part specifically, but to see those rings up close would sure be a treat.

Or see the big red eye of Jupiter up close, that'd be very impressive as well, I'm sure.
Yeah Saturn would be great. Seeing the rings and all. Also has a lot of cool moons to sightsee.
Mars, with some advanced tech....
I'd imagine low sun orbit would be pretty amazing if you're guaranteeing us a spacecraft survive the conditions and return us safely.
I never though about gas giant orbits... being on Ganymede or Io would be cool seeing the other moons.
Europa - especially if the trip included a way to go under the ice

Io, Triton or Titan. Can't make up my mind. The first two are actually active and something happens there on a daily basis.

Io would be freakishly scary. Huge Jupiter in the sky would be the worst thing. I'm ok with lava, though.

Titan would be cool because of the hydrocarbon oceans, but if I can't deal with Earth's watery oceans, I sure wouldn't go for a swim in fuc*ing petrol under a gloomy orange sky. It's like one of my nightmares.

Swimming on Titan would be the most horrifying things ever to happen. Especially in a spacesuit. Restricted movement slow reactions and the fact if you are alone you would probably drown and sink until you ran out of oxygen. At the bottom of a -270c lake with no waves under a dark orange sky.
Hawaii. Well, that's in the solar system.

Honestly... probably Mars. It's just so interesting. Although I'm sure I'd get there and then get bored and wish I'd gone to some moon so I could at least look up in the sky and see a freaking gas giant overhead...

Minmas.

The thing looks like THE DEATH STAR!
Maybe under the ice of Europa, or to Phobos/Deimos. It would be so fun to frolic around in near-0 g!
The thing looks like THE DEATH STAR!
It would be cool to see the active cryovolcanos at Enceladus's south pole. And unlike Titan, you could actually see Saturn from the surface.

Well... it would largely depend on the duration of travel and so.

If it is just for 1 week or so, with near instanteneous travel, I say Enceladus too.

Because gaysers 10x times the size of Everest and Saturn nearby with DEM RINGS.

However if it is for 10 years or something including travel time. Yeah... I think I will pick Hawaii too.

To be honest I think this is a good Question. There are many places in the Solar System I would like to go to. Like Titan, Europa, Enceladus, Triton, Miranda, Mars, and my personal favorite Venus. The problem is that there is so much to learn from in our solar system, and just in general cool places and environments.

Io, Triton or Titan. Can't make up my mind. The first two are actually active and something happens there on a daily basis.

Io would be freakishly scary. Huge Jupiter in the sky would be the worst thing. I'm ok with lava, though.

Titan would be cool because of the hydrocarbon oceans, but if I can't deal with Earth's watery oceans, I sure wouldn't go for a swim in fuc*ing petrol under a gloomy orange sky. It's like one of my nightmares.

Io would be great, as I love lava too. But you would be bathed in radiation.

Enceladus would be far better than Europa concerning radiation and ocean access. You would have to drill through a few kilometers of ice on Europa. But, I think it may be a better location in the oceans than on Enceladus.

Edited October 9, 2013 by mdatspace

Sedna. The farthest observed object in our solar system on the fringes of the inner Oort cloud. It's apparently almost as red as Mars. Id love to stand on its surface and see our sun as just another bright star in the sky.

1) Diving in Europa's oceans

2) See the geyers on Enceladus

3) Liquid hydrocarbon skiing on Titan

4) Blimp ride on Titan

5) Spelunking on Mars- if you don't know what I'm talking about, see these-

We've found more than just those, too.

Anyway, those would be on my "bucket list" if we had cheap tourism to the solar system bodies.
The center of the earth. I'll bring a device to suck out the magma, and then have near zero-g fun in the center of the earth.
The moon. Hadley Rille and walk around out there enjoying the lunar landscape.

5) Spelunking on Mars

The moment I saw those holes few years ago, I thought of this.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C9IahHYceQc

So... thanks, but no thanks.

All depends on duration.

A few hours? Europa, Io, Near the surface of the sun, Venus, somewhere extreme but since your'e gurenteeing survival... TAKE PICTurES AND UPLOAD ALL THE THINGS!

If it were long duration. Mars. Definitely mars.

If it were Extremely Long duration: Hawaii
